message.content:
A hendiadys (from Ancient Greek: ἕνδιαδυς, henidiadeus) is a figure of speech in which two or more words are combined to express a single concept. It is often used for emphasis and can be found in many languages, including English.

Examples of hendiadys include:
- "The quick brown fox" (used as an example of pangram)
- "Peace through strength" (a common slogan during the Cold War)
- "Love at first sight" (describing a strong and immediate attraction to someone)
